titles.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles / Täʾamrä Mikaʾel “Miracles of Michael” / Homily on St. Michael (story about St. Tälason)

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-11rb, 12ra-166vb) I-1) The Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul, with colophon (fols. 1ra-11vb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 12ra-12va) I-3) The Preaching of St. Peter (fols. 12va-23rb) I-4) The Martyrdom of St. Peter (fols. 23va-27vb) I-5) The Martyrdom of St. Paul (fols. 28ra-30ra) I-6) The Preaching of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 30ra-31vb) I-7) The Martyrdom of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 31vb-32vb) I-8) The Preaching of St. James the Just (fols. 33ra-34rb) I-9) The Martyrdom of St. James the Just (fols. 34rb-36vb) I-10) The Preaching of St. Bartholomew (fols. 36vb-41ra) I-11) The Martyrdom of St. Bartholomew (fols. 41rb-43va) I-12) The Acts of St. Matthew (fols. 43va-50rb) I-13) The Martyrdom of St. Matthew (fols. 50ra-52rb) I-14) The Martyrdom of St. Luke (fols. 52rb-55ra) I-15) The Preaching of St. Philip (fols. 55ra-59ra) I-16) The Martyrdom of St. Philip (fols. 59ra-61rb) I-17) The Preaching of St. Andrew (fols. 61va-69va) I-18) The Acts of Sts. Andrew and Bartholomew (fols. 69va-82rb) I-19) The Acts of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 83ra-95va) I-20) The Death of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 95va-99rb) I-21) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Alphaeus (fols. 99rb-100ra) I-22) The Preaching of St. Matthias (fols. 100ra-109vb) I-23) The Martyrdom of St. Matthias (fols. 109vb-112vb) I-24) The Acts of St. James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 112vb-115vb) I-25) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Zebedee, with colophon (fols. 115vb-117vb) I-26) The Martyrdom of St. Mark the Evangelist (fols. 118ra-120va) I-27) The Preaching of St. Thomas (fols. 120va-128vb) I-28) The Martyrdom of St. Thomas (fols. 129ra-132ra) I-29) The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus (fols. 132ra-135vb) I-30) The Acts of Sts. Matthias and Andrew, presented as Acts of St. Andrew (fols. 136ra-147va) I-31) The Acts of St. Thomas, I (fols 148ra-152vb) I-32) The Acts of St. Thomas, II (fols. 152vb-157rb) I-33) The Acts of St. Thomas, III (fols. 157rb-161va) I-34) The Acts of St. Thomas, IV (fols. 161va-163vb) I-35) The Acts of St. Thomas, V (fols. 163vb-166vb) II) Täʾamrä Mikaʾel “Miracles of Michael”: 12 miracles (fols. 167ra-174vb) III) Homily on Archangel Michael (story about St. Tälason) (fols. 175ra-180rb).

donors.donor: Gäbäz-priests (qäsäwǝstä gabäz) Bäkwǝrä Ṣǝyon, Mänqorewos (sic), Täsfa Ḥǝyǝwät are mentioned as commissioners (zǝntu gädlä ḥawaryat zä-Ṗaraqliṭos zä-ʾaṣḥafu...) in the subscriptio to Text I-1 (fol. 117vb ls. 3-5). A subscriptio to Text II (fol. 174va) states that it was commissioned (ʾagbäru) by the priests of the Ṗaraqliṭos.

txstates.txstate: The front cover is broken and repaired. The Ms. has been resewn; the sewing is damaged. Some leaves are affected by humidity in the inner upper margins (esp. fols. 2r-19r, 58rv). Holes on fols. 139, 140, 141, 147, 178, 179, 180, 181, 182. Cuts carefully amended, fols. 19, 56, 61, 62. Some leaves are cut: fols. 82 (the bottom margin), 134, 172-173, 180 (the outer margin). Fols. 176-182 as well as the back board are damaged at the upper edge (probably by rodents).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations. A piece of textile (cotton, gauze?) is crudely sewn between the front board and the first leaf (likely as a fly-leaf).

squires.squire: I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r - 16v) – III(8/fols. 17r - 24v) – IV(8/fols. 25r - 32v) – V(8/fols. 33r - 40v) – VI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2 /fols. 41r - 48v) – VII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 49r - 56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r - 64v) – IX(8/fols. 65r - 72v) – X(8/fols. 73r - 80v) – XI(2/fols. 81r – 82v) – XII(8/fols. 83r – 90v) – XIII(8/fols. 91r – 98v) – XIV(8/fols. 99r – 106v) – XV(8/fols. 107r – 114v) – XVI(3; s.l.: 2, stub before 3/fols. 115r – 117v) – XVII(8/fols. 118r – 125v) – XVIII(11; s.l.: 6, stub after 3; 8, stub after 2; 11, stub before 1/fols. 126r – 135v) – XIX(8/fols. 136r – 143v) – XX(4/fols. 144r-147v) – XXI(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XXII(8/fols. 156r-163v) – XXIII(3; s.l.: 2, stub before 3/fols. 164r-167v) – XXIV(10/fols. 168r-176v) – XXV(4/fols. 177r-180v) – B(2/fols. 181r-182v).

taunit.ln-info: The number of lines is irregular, varying greatly, between 22 and 31
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling (in a few cases also below, e.g., fols. 55v, 56r).

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by upright to slightly left-sloping letters, uneven and not uniform (also number of the lines pro page is not constant), at times creating an impression of more than hands involved in writing. In fols. 61r, 71vb, 72va, the handwriting appears different: broader strokes, less carefully executed with a different tone of black ink. Some distinct features: - መ (esp. in the 1st and 2nd orders) has loops of triangular shape, with the left loop more sharply pointed - the upper horizontal strokes of some letters (e.g., መ ሠ በ) are uniformly slanted to the left - some letters have rounded upper strokes, e.g., the letter ገ in the 6th order - the 6th order marker of ጰ is set up on the vertical stroke at the top and oriented to the left (e.g., fols. 11ra l.24, 45va l.19) - the 6th order marker of the letter የ has a very short and downwards oriented left part, and a long, upwards oriented right part (e.g., fols. 45vb l.5); in the 4th order, the marker is diagonal and going down below the ruling (e.g., fol. 45vb l.7); the letters ኀ and ቀ in the 4th order show the same feature - the loop marking the 7th order of letter ቀ is very pronounced, broad and elevates above other signs - ፲ appears occasionally in the form with a ring attached to the right side through a horizontal stroke (fol. 135vb l.7).

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I, II and III; the incipit of each text within Text I and sometimes one or two lines of the account proper; one or two lines in the incipit of each miracle in Text-II; trinitarian formula; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the punctuation signs and of coronis signs.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
In Text I, for each text the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following: I-1) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH I-2) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH I-3) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH I-4) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH I-5) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH I-6) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH I-7) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH I-8) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH I-9) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH I-10) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH I-11) BConAp I, 93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH I-12) BConAp I, 101-13; BConAp II, 93-108; Mt1 in BauGaH I-13) BConAp I, 114-18; BConAp II, 109-14; Mt2 in BauGaH I-14) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH I-15) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH I-16) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH I-17) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH I-18) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-80; AnB in BauGaH I-19) BConAp I, 189-213; BConAp II, 186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH I-20) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH I-21) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH I-22) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH I-23) BConAp I, 243-246; BConAp II, 241-45; Ma2 in BauGaH I-24) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH I-25) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH I-26) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH I-27) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH I-28) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH I-29) BConAp I, 296-306; BConAp II, 296-306; Jud in BauGaH I-30) BConAp I, 307-35; BConAp II, 307-34; MAn in BauGaH I-31) BConAp I, 336-46; 335-46; Th3 in BauGaH I-32) BConAp I, 347-57; BConAp II, 347-57; Th4 in BauGaH I-33) BConAp I, 358-67; BConAp II, 358-65; Th5 in BauGaH I-34) BConAp I, 368-73; BConAp II, 368-75; Th6 in BauGaH I-35) BConAp I, 373-81; BConAp II, 376-84; Th7 in BauGaH.
- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat of AP-016 would belong to IV recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84). Text I-4, the Martyrdom pf St. Peter, contains the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34). - Text I-1 is separated from the following ones by a blank folio. It ends with a subscriptio (supplication) separated from the main text by a chain of black and red dots with dashes in between. - Text I-25 ends with a subscriptio (note on the the commissioners and supplication). - Most of the texts are separated by a chain of red and black dots with dashes in between. - In Text II, the miracles are separated from the each other by a chain of red and black dots with dashes in between. The text ends with tree subscriptiones separated by chain of red and black dots with dashes in between. - Text II ends with three extensive subscriptiones (fol. 174v): supplication for commissioners; supplication for commissioners, scribe, reader etc.; condemnation against those who take the book away. - The incipit of Text III reads as follows: Fol: 175ra: ድርሳን፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ አባ፡ ደማቲዮስ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ዘኢየሩሳሌም፡ ዘደረሰ፡ በእንተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ገባሬ፡ ተአምር፡ ወመንክር፡ ወበእንተ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወንጹሕ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ተላሶን፡ ዘአምነ፡ በእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኀኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን። ... According to the incipit the homily was composed by (Timothy) Dämatiyos, Metropolitan of Jerusalem.

extras.extra: - Correction written over erasure: e.g., fols. 44rb, 46rb, 47rb, 49ra, 70va. - In some fols., the scribe did not use the upper or the bottom ruled lines, e.g., fols. 1r, 45r, 83rv, 85r, 115r, 176r. In fol. 117rb one ruled line is empty between the explicit and the subscriptio. - On fol. 135v (after Text I-29), a chain of coronis with a chain of red and black dots and dashes below and above. - The paragraph sign is used especially on fols. 2v and 91r. - Compressed script (in red ink of a different tone?) is used in rubrications: e.g., fols. 43va, 50rb. - A drawing of the cross (or doodle?) in the bottom margin of fol. 44r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The commemoration dates of the Apostles or notes summarizing the content are written in red and black (by the same hand as that of the main text) in the upper margin (a few times also in the lateral margins) of some fols.: ግንዘቱ፡ ወስምዑ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡: fol. 23v አመ፡ ፲ለሐምሌ፡: fol. 30r አም፬ለታኅሣሥ፡ እንድርያስ፡: fol. 61v በዘ፡ ገብረ፡ እንድርያስ፡: fol. 69v አመ፡ ፬፡ ለወርኀ፡ ጥር፡ [n.l.] ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘብዴዎስ፡: fol. 83r አመ፡ ፲ለየካቲት፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ እልፍዮስ፡: fol. 99r አመ፡ ፰ለመጋቢት፡ ማቲያስ፡: fol. 100r አመ፡ ሰሙኑ፡ ለመጋቢት፡: fol. 109v አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፡ [n.l.] ለሚያዝያ፡: fol. 112v አመ፡ ፴ለሚያዝያ፡: fol. 118r አመ፡ ፳፡ ወ፯፡ ለግንቦት።: fol. 120v አመ፡ ፪፡ ለሔ[sic]ምሌ፡: fol. 132r አመ፡ ፴፡ ለነኃሴ፡: fol. 136r አመ፡ ፲፡ ወ፰፡ ለመስከረም።: fol. 148r አመ፡ ፱፡ ለጥቅምት፡: fol. 152v (written twice) አመ፡ ፪ለያከቲት[sic]፡: fol. 157r ግብር፡ ፫: fol. 157r (right margin) አመ፡ ፲፬ለመጋቢት፡: fol. 161v ግብር፡ ፬: fol. 161v (left margin) አመ፡ [n.l.] (above); ግብር፡ ፭ (below): fol. 163v - monthly readings for Text II are indicated in red in the upper margin: እም፡ ፲ወ፪ለስኔ፡ ምንበብ፡: fol. 167r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለኀምሌ፡ ምንበብ፡; አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለነሐሲ፡ ምንበብ፡: fol. 167v በመስከረም፡ ምንበብ፡: fol. 168r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለጥቅምት፡: fol. 168v አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለኀዳር።: fol. 169r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለታኅሣሥ፡: fol. 170r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለጥር፡: fol. 170v አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለየኪ[sic]ቲት፡: fol. 171r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለመጋቢት፡: fol. 171v አመ፡ ፲ወ፪ለሚያዝያ፡: fol. 172r አመ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለግንቦት።: fol. 173r - the date of monthly reading for the “Homily of Timothy” is indicated in red in the upper margin of fol. 175r: አመ፡ ፲፪፡ ለታኅሣሥ፡
